meanings.sent1: The swashbucklers in the story bravely fought off the pirates.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of exciting swashbucklers swinging their swords.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be swashbucklers on a treasure hunt in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His confidence and skill with a sword made him a true swashbuckler in the eyes of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the swashbuckler with a gleaming sword was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: A daring or reckless person, especially one who engages in daring escapades or exploits
meanings.sent1: The group of swashbucklers decided to explore the haunted house despite the warnings.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a swashbuckler for her fearless stunts and adventures.
meanings.sent3: The swashbucklers thought it would be fun to sneak into the zoo after hours.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, he was considered a swashbuckler for taking risky investments.
meanings.sent5: The young boy admired the swashbuckler who fearlessly climbed the tallest tree in the park.
